definition.text: A complication following Endovascular Aortic Repair (EVAR) characterized by persistent blood flow into the aneurysm sac through retrograde flow from patent collateral branch vessels, most commonly lumbar arteries and the inferior mesenteric artery

usage_notes: Always specify 'Type 2' or 'Type II' to distinguish from other endoleak classifications
Generally lower urgency than Type 1 or 3

style_guide_compliance.number_style: Use Arabic numeral '2' or Roman 'II' (both acceptable)
style_guide_compliance.hyphenation: No hyphen between Type and endoleak
style_guide_compliance.abbreviation_rule: Spell out on first use; 'Type 2 EL' acceptable in tables

mesh.heading: Endoleak
mesh.note: Use general endoleak term; MeSH does not distinguish types

icd11.title: Other specified complications following procedures on circulatory system
icd11.note: Requires extension code for Type 2 specificity

context_specific_usage.clinical_notes: Type 2 endoleak noted on follow-up CTA
context_specific_usage.radiology_reports: Type II endoleak with retrograde filling via lumbar arteries
context_specific_usage.discharge_summary: Post-EVAR Type 2 endoleak, stable, observation recommended
context_specific_usage.literature_search: Search terms: 'Type 2 endoleak' OR 'Type II endoleak' OR 'endoleak' [MeSH]

authoritative_sources.title: Society for Vascular Surgery practice guidelines for EVAR follow-up
